item.title: 5 sexual misconduct
item.description: 5 types of sexual relations which involve sexual misconduct: 1. Anyone under the guardianship of their parents, i.e. under-aged 2. Protected by Dhamma, monks, nuns or those who have taken a vow of celibacy 3.

item.title: 5 Strengths
item.description: 5 Strengths: 1. Faith 2. Energy 3. Mindfulness 4. Concentration 5. Wisdom (from Anguttara Nikaya 5.2)

item.title: 5 Aggregates
item.description: 5 Aggregates of the human personality: 1. Matter (form) 2. Consciousness 3. Feeling 4. Perception and Memory 5. Mental Formations (from Samyutta Nikaya 22.

item.title: 5 grave deeds (leading to rebirth in a hell)
item.description: 5 grave deeds (leading to rebirth in a hell): 1. One who has killed his/her mother 2. One who has killed his/her father 3.

item.title: 5 Hindrances
item.description: 5 Hindrances to Meditation: 1. Sense desire 2. Anger 3. Sloth and torpor 4. Agitation and worry 5. Extreme skepticism (from Anguttara Nikaya 9.

item.title: 5 Jhanic Factors
item.description: 5 Jhanic Factors: 1. Aiming (initial, access concentration) 2. Sustained concentration 3. Rapture or delight 4. Happiness 5. One-pointedness concentration

item.title: 5 levels of cause and effect
item.description: 5 levels of cause and effect: 1. Non-living matter (physical world) 2. Seed (biological world) 3. Mind (psychological) 4. Kamma 5.

item.title: 5 Precepts
item.description: 5 Precepts for lay people: 1. Abstention of taking the life of any living being 2. Abstention from stealing 3. Abstention from sexual misconduct 4.

item.title: 5 Spiritual Faculties
item.description: 5 Spiritual Faculties: 1. Faith 2. Energy 3. Mindfulness 4. Concentration 5. Wisdom (from Samyutta Nikaya 48.10)

item.title: 5 subjects for impermanence recollection
item.description: 5 subjects for impermanence recollection: 1. I am of the nature to decay, I have not gone beyond decay. 2. I am of the nature to be diseased; I have not gone beyond disease.

item.title: 5 substitutes for the five hindrances
item.description: 5 substitutes for the five hindrances: 1. Sense desire & lust (kama-chanda) should be substituted with attention on disgusting aspects. 2.

item.title: 5 types of feeling
item.description: 5 types of feeling: 1. The faculty of pleasure 2. The faculty of pain 3. The faculty of gladness 4. The faculty of sadness 5.

item.title: 5 types of Right Speech
item.description: 5 types of Right Speech: 1. Timely 2. True 3. Gentle 4. Purposeful 5. Spoken with loving-kindness (from Anguttara Nikaya 5.

item.title: 5 types of wrong livelihood
item.description: 5 types of wrong livelihood: 1. Trading weapons 2. Trading in human beings (such as slavery), 3. Trading in intoxicating drinks and narcotics 4.
